oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Maximal $k$-Edge-Colorable Subgraphs, Vizing's Theorem, and Tuza's Conjecture
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Puleo, Gregory J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Combinatorics
05C15
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We prove that if $M$ is a maximal $k$-edge-colorable subgraph of a multigraph $G$ and if $F = \{v \in V(G) : d_M(v) \leq k-\mu(v)\}$, then $d_F(v) \leq d_M(v)$ for all $v \in F$. This implies Vizing's Theorem as well as a special case of Tuza's Conjecture on packing and covering of triangles. A more detailed version of our result also implies Vizing's Adjacency Lemma for simple graphs.
Comment: 10 pages. Proved a stronger version of the main theorem implying Vizing's Adjacency Lemma, and incorporated some material from arXiv:1407.2336 to make the paper more self-contained
